data.title: 10 People on the Move - Risk & Insurance
data.meta_description: QBE announces four appointments to leadership team, HOMELINK adds two sales executives, PartnerRe appoints new Board of Directors member.
data.text:
QBE Announces Four Additions to Leadership Team

QBE recently announced the hiring of four executives.

Thomas Kocaj was appointed as senior vice president, head of management liability. In this role, Kocaj will manage the oversight on QBE’s development and implementation of market strategy. He brings over 30 years of industry experience to QBE and most recently served at Berkshire Hathaway Specialty Insurance, where he lead the management liability underwriting team.

QBE hired Danielle Librizzi as senior vice president, head of professional liability. She will head the team of professional liability and cyber underwriters nationwide. She joins QBE from Berkshire Hathaway Specialty Insurance, where she held a similar position.

Adam Fleischner was named senior vice president, financial institutions. In his new role, Fleischner will manage a team of financial institutions underwriters to successfully deliver QBE’s go-to-market plan. Fleischner also joined QBE from Berkshire Hathaway Specialty Insurance, where he managed the financial institutions business in both New York City and San Francisco.

Michael McGuinness was hired as QBE’s senior vice president, public company management liability. In this role, McGuinness will be responsible for the management of the public company underwriting team. He previously served as Berkshire Hathaway Specialty Insurance’s vice president of financial lines for both public and private/nonprofit commercial institutions.

Allianz Global Corporate & Specialty Announces Promotion of Katie Fioretti

Allianz Global Corporate & Specialty (AGCS) promoted Katie Fioretti to regional head of portfolio steering for financial lines in North America.

In this role, Fioretti will lead a team working on portfolio management and technical excellence with a particular focus on strategy and risk management across commercial, financial institutions, professional indemnity and cyber lines.

Fioretti brings nearly 20 years of management liability experience to her new role with ACGS. She first joined the firm in 2015, most recently serving as the regional head of commercial management liability.

“Katie is a proven industry professional with a strong skillset and market experience that will have a significant impact on the growth of our Financial Lines business,” said Joe Caruso, regional head of financial lines, North America

“AGCS is committed to bringing our clients an unparalleled level of service and solutions, and I look forward to working with Katie to exceed our clients’ expectations.

HOMELINK Brings on Two Additions to Sales Team

HOMELINK recently announced the appointments of Danny Real and Jason Collins to the company’s sales team.

Collins was hired as vice president of commercial sales. He brings 22 years of industry experience, specifically in the workers’ compensation and cost containment sectors, to his role with HOMELINK. He also brings sales leadership and account management to the company.

Real, was named vice president of sales and account management. He brings over 30 years of workers’ compensation and managed care experience to HOMELINK.

“I, along with the rest of the HOMELINK family, welcome Jason Collins and Danny Real,” said Matt Waller, senior vice president of HOMELINK.

“Over the past 28 years, HOMELINK has built a reputation for providing unparalleled customer service and value to its clients nationwide. The expertise Jason and Danny bring helps us further our vision to humanize, simplify, and raise the bar in ancillary services within the healthcare industry.”

Ushur Announces Hiring of Kashif Mahbub in Executive Position

Ushur, a company that specializes in helping businesses intelligently automate and digitally transform customer-facing workflows, hired Kashif Mahbub as senior vice president of marketing.

In this role, Mahbub will be responsible for the oversight of the company’s marketing strategies and function, which includes brand, communications, community and digital marketing. Additionally, he will manage Ushur’s goal of implementing its AI platform and solutions.

Mahbub brings over 20 years of experience, specifically in global technology and brand marketing, to his role with Ushur. He most recently served as the vice president of product marketing at Automation Anywhere, where he helped create and develop several marketing initiatives.

“I am thrilled to have Kashif’s outstanding talent become part of Ushur’s leadership team at such a critical juncture in our journey,” said Simha Sadasiva, CEO and co-founder at Ushur.

“Kashif’s deep experience in category design, global brand development and building high-performance go-to-market functions will play a pivotal role in bringing Ushur’s unique brand of intelligent customer engagement solutions to the global market.”

Peter Child to Lead Strategic Risk Solutions Operations in Guernsey

Strategic Risk Solutions (SRS) recently announced the launch of operations in Guernsey with Peter Child named as managing director.

In this role, Child will be responsible for overseeing the development of SRS business and operations in Guernsey.

Child has worked in the industry for several years and has experience in data analytics, sales and underwriting. He most recently worked with Artex, which he joined in 2007, where he managed the company’s office in Guernsey, Malta, Gibraltar and London. Additionally, he managed oversight of insurance management services.

“We are pleased to be able to establish an office in Guernsey — a great place to do business, with its solid regulatory framework, strong infrastructure, and a vibrant and growing insurance market,” said SRS CEO Brady Young.

“Adding Peter to our talented management team is a pivotal next step in the execution of our strategy to expand our customer base and to extend our geographic reach.

PartnerRe Announces New Board of Directors Appointment

Enrico Vellano was appointed to PartnerRe’s Board of Directors as a representative of Exor.

Vellano brings over 20 years of insurance industry experience to his new role with PartnerRe. He began his career with IFIL and was named their chief financial officer in 2006. He most recently served as the chief financial officer for Exor.

John Elkann, chairman and chief executive officer of Exor, commented on Vellano’s new appointment, “Enrico Vellano has been closely involved in all aspects of our investment in PartnerRe since the very beginning and I’m delighted that he is succeeding me on the board in a further signal of our long-term commitment to the Company and its independent strategy.” &
